headline: Canada tariffs: Trudeau hits back against Trump with 25% levy
summary: Canada imposes 25% retaliatory tariffs on $106.6bn worth of US goods in response to Trump's tariffs, targeting items like beer, wine, and household appliances, with potential economic impacts on both countries.

headline: US taxes imports from Canada, Mexico and China as Trump's tariffs begin
summary: The US imposes tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico, and China, prompting vows of retaliation. The tariffs aim to address concerns over illegal immigration and drug trafficking, with potential economic impacts on trade and consumer prices.

headline: Fact Sheet: President Donald J. Trump Imposes Tariffs on Imports from Canada, Mexico and China – The White House
summary: President Trump imposes tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico, and China, citing national emergency and commitment to border security and trade policy.

headline: Canada - Import Tariffs | Privacy Shield
summary: Canada eliminated tariffs on most goods, except dairy and poultry. The U.S. Department of Commerce manages the Privacy Shield framework.

headline: Here’s what will get more expensive from Trump’s tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China | CNN Business
summary: Trump imposes 25% tariffs on Mexico and most Canadian goods, 10% on Chinese imports, affecting fruits, vegetables, gas, autos, electronics, and more. Economists warn of price hikes for consumers and supply chain disruptions.

headline: President Trump signs order to impose tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China | AP News
summary: President Trump imposes tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China, prompting retaliation and concerns over economic impact.

headline: Trump imposes tariffs on Mexico, Canada and China | Donald Trump News | Al Jazeera
summary: Trump imposes 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico, 10% on China, citing a national emergency. Canada and Mexico retaliate with matching tariffs, warning of economic consequences.

headline: Trump says he'll place tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China on Saturday | AP News
summary: President Trump imposes 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico, and 10% on China, effective Saturday. This may increase prices for U.S. consumers and draw retaliation.

headline: Fact Sheet: President Donald J. Trump Imposes Tariffs on Imports from Canada, Mexico and China – The White House
summary: President Trump imposes tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico, and China, citing a national emergency due to illegal aliens and drugs, leveraging economic powers to secure borders.
